vehicles.description: A black SUV is located on the right-hand lane of the road, moving in the same direction as our vehicle, and it might be moving or stationary.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle is located in the parking lane and may pose a potential hazard, as its doors might suddenly open or passengers could accidentally disembark. It also reduces the road space available for our car.

vehicles.description: A green tour bus is on the left side of this vehicle, coming from the opposite direction.
vehicles.explanation: This vehicle may slightly obstruct the view of the road to the left of our car; attention should be paid to any sudden stops or turns.

vehicles.description: A vehicle is parked in the right lane, seemingly occupying a parking space.
vehicles.explanation: These vehicles restrict the available width of the road and may require this vehicle to move slightly to the left to maintain a safe distance when passing.

vehicles.description: A black car is on the road ahead of us, followed by other traffic.
vehicles.explanation: The vehicle must maintain a safe distance from that vehicle and be alert for any sudden stops or turns at all times.

vulnerable_road_users.description: There are several pedestrians on the right side of the sidewalk, some of whom are near the edge of the sidewalk, close to the road.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Pedestrians near the roadside may enter the roadway, therefore, the vehicle must closely monitor them.

vulnerable_road_users.description: A person riding a bicycle on the road in the same direction as traffic, on the right side of a self-driving vehicle.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Bicyclists and motor vehicles sharing the road can affect traffic flow or cause sudden changes, requiring drivers to remain vigilant.

vulnerable_road_users.description: Pedestrians walk on the sidewalk on the left side of the road for self-driving cars.
vulnerable_road_users.explanation: Although they are not on the road, their proximity to the roadway highlights the necessity of being cautious in case someone steps onto the lane.

traffic signs.description: The pedestrian crossing sign is located next to the sidewalk, indicating areas where pedestrians may intend to cross or are currently crossing the street.
traffic signs.explanation: The appearance of these signs may indicate an increase in pedestrian activity and potential jaywalking behavior, alerting the driver to slow down and prepare to stop.

other objects.description: Trees and street lamps are lined up along the sidewalk on the left.
other objects.explanation: These elements do not directly affect driving behavior, but if pedestrians emerge from behind these obstacles, they should be given attention.

general_perception.description and explanation:
In the observed traffic scene, several vehicles are noted on the road. There is a black SUV on the right-hand lane that could be stationary or moving; it poses potential hazards related to door openings or passengers disembarking, which may reduce the available road space for our vehicle. A green tour bus is approaching from the opposite direction on the left side, potentially obstructing the road view. Another vehicle is parked on the same side in a parking space, necessitating a slight diversion of our vehicle to the left for safe passage. Additionally, a black car is traveling ahead, followed by other vehicles, and our vehicle needs to maintain a safe following distance and stay alert for sudden stops or turns.

Vulnerable road users in the scene include pedestrians near the edge of the sidewalk on the right, necessitating vigilance as they might step onto the road. A cyclist is also sharing the road on the right side, moving in the same direction as traffic. This requires the driver to be vigilant about the shared road space. On the left sidewalk, pedestrians walking parallel to the self-driving vehicle also require attention should any of them enter the roadway.

Regarding traffic signs, there is a pedestrian crossing sign next to the sidewalk signaling areas of potential pedestrian crosswalks, which could lead to an increase in pedestrian activity and necessitates heightened caution and readiness to stop.

Other elements in the scene include trees and street lamps aligned along the left sidewalk. While these do not directly affect driving behavior, they could obscure pedestrians, requiring additional focus from the vehicleâ€™s sensors and driver.

This image lacks any traffic lights, traffic cones, or barriers that would affect driving decisions or require additional maneuvers.

driving_suggestion: Autonomous vehicles should maintain a safe distance from the black SUV ahead, ready to respond to any pedestrians attempting to cross the street from the sidewalk, especially near pedestrian signs, and keep a safe distance from cyclists. Additionally, observe the behavior of the green tour bus to see if there are any signs of entering the traffic lane. Drive cautiously at a safe speed in mixed traffic environments. Stay alert to the dynamics of the green tour bus and cyclists. Be prepared to stop or yield where pedestrians cross the street, as indicated by signs. Autonomous vehicles should maintain a moderate speed to ensure there is enough distance to safely respond to the dynamics of motorcyclists and vehicles ahead. It is recommended to frequently check the rearview mirror to monitor the surrounding traffic situation. When overtaking vehicles parked on the roadside, slightly increase the lateral spacing, but do not deviate into the opposite lane. Pay close attention to pedestrians on both sides of the road to see if there are any signs of crossing.

1.description and explanation: A metal barrier is positioned in the center of the road. This barrier serves as a physical separation, likely demarcating lanes or directing traffic flow. The presence of this barrier will require the ego car to adapt its driving behavior by staying in the correct lane and being mindful of the change in traffic patterns that the barrier enforces.

2.description and explanation: A portable barrier, used to block off an area or indicate that part of the road is not accessible. The ego car must take this into consideration and avoid driving into or obstructing the restricted area delineated by the barrier.
